intro: Stisseria pulchella, commonly known as the pretty stisseria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Stisseria pulchella is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
